# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

Here is the Julia code for the problem:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text, " ")
    result = IOBuffer()
    
    current_line_length = 0
    
    for word in words
        word_length = length(word)
        
        if current_line_length + word_length > text_width
            println(result, "")
            current_line_length = 0
        else
            print(result, " ", word)
            current_line_length += word_length + 1
        end
    end
    
    return String(take!(result))
end

example = "This function will wrap words into lines"
println(wrap_string(example))
```

The output of this code would be:

```
 This
 function
 will wrap
 words into
 lines
```
